Disabling an Ext.Button component in Ext JS

The following example shows how you can disable an Ext.Button component in Ext JS by setting the Boolean disabled config or by calling the setDisabled() method at runtime.

Tags:

  • Ext JS
  • Ext JS 4.0.7
  • Ext.Button
  • Ext.button.Button
  • button
  • disabled
  • setDisabled()
[example]

See Also:

  • Ext.button.Button Documentation
© 2012 Sencha Inc. 
/*global Ext:false */
Ext.onReady(function () {
    var btn = Ext.create("Ext.Button", {
        disabled: true,
        handler: function () {
            Ext.Msg.alert("", "You clicked the button.");
        },
        text: 'Button'
    });
    
    Ext.create('Ext.Panel', {
        bodyPadding: 20,
        items: [btn],
        renderTo: Ext.getBody(),
        tbar: [{
            xtype: "checkbox",
            boxLabel: "disabled",
            checked: btn.disabled,
            handler: function () {
                btn.setDisabled(this.checked);
            }
        }]
    });
});
